p: Terpenoids are classified according to the number of their isoprene unit as hemi-, mono-, di-, tri-, tetra-, and polyterpenes [ 58]. Various studies reported that the anticancer activity of terpenoids is due to the inhibition of inflammation, cancer cell proliferation, angiogenesis and metastasis, and induction of programmed cell death [ 59]. Triterpenoids are one important class of terpenoids, which contain isopentenyl pyrophosphate oligomers [ 60]. They are biosynthesized by plants through cyclization of 30-carbon intermediate squalene and include various structural subclasses [ 61]. Several triterpenoids have been shown to have anticancer activity.
